title._content: Ruins of Fort Phantom Hill, Jones County.

description._content: Title: Ruins of Fort Phantom Hill, Jones County. Creator: Robertson, George (photographer) Contributors: Oliphant, W. J. (publisher) Date: 1874 Series: Life on the Frontier Description: In 1874 W. J. Oliphant published a series of stereoscopic views of a Texas buffalo hunt. The photographs were taken in and around Taylor County, near present-day Abilene and Buffalo Gap, by an Oliphant friend and part-time employee, George Robertson. These stereographs are among the earliest known photographs of a buffalo hunt. Source: Lawrence T. Jones III. Physical Description: 1 photographic print on stereo card: stereograph, albumen; 11.3 x 18 cm. File: ag2008_0005_7_5_064_c_ruins_opt.jpg Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/cdm/ref/collection/jtx/id/714 View Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
